016
017package de.mnl.osgi.jul2osgi.lib;
018
019import java.util.ArrayList;
020import java.util.Deque;
021import java.util.LinkedList;
022import java.util.List;
023import java.util.logging.LogRecord;
024import java.util.logging.Logger;
025
026/**
027 * An implementation of {@link java.util.logging.LogManager}. The 
028 * system property {@code java.util.logging.manager} must be set to 
029 * {@code de.mnl.osgi.jul2osgi.LogManager} in order for this manager to be
030 * used. The library that provides this implementation must be
031 * on the system classpath (e.g. using {@code bnd}'s
032 * <a href=https://bnd.bndtools.org/instructions/runpath.html>{@code -runpath}</a>
033 * instruction. 
034 */
035public class LogManager extends java.util.logging.LogManager {
036
037    private Deque<LogInfo> buffered = new LinkedList<>();
038    private int bufferSize = 100;
039    private LogRecordHandler forwarder;
040
041    /**
042     * Instantiates a new log manager.
043     */
044    public LogManager() {
045        try {
046            bufferSize = Integer.parseInt(System.getProperty(
047                "de.mnl.osgi.jul2osgi.bufferSize", "100"));
048        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
049            // Left to default if invaid.
050        }
051    }
052
053    /*
054     * (non-Javadoc)
055     * 
056     * @see java.util.logging.LogManager#getLogger(java.lang.String)
057     */
058    @Override
059    public Logger getLogger(final String name) {
060        Logger logger = super.getLogger(name);
061        return logger;
062    }
063
064    /*
065     * (non-Javadoc)
066     * 
067     * @see java.util.logging.LogManager#addLogger(java.util.logging.Logger)
068     */
069    @Override
070    public boolean addLogger(Logger logger) {
071        // It's hard to believe but this effectively overwrites the
072        // Logger#getLogger factory methods.
073        if (!(logger instanceof ForwardingLogger)) {
074            logger = new ForwardingLogger(this, logger);
075        }
076        super.addLogger(logger);
077        return false;
078    }
079
080    /**
081     * Sets the forwarder.
082     *
083     * @param forwarder the new forwarder
084     */
085    public void setForwarder(LogRecordHandler forwarder) {
086        // It may be that the forwarder is used by a call to
087        // #log before all records from the buffer have been
088        // flushed, thus changing the proper sequence.
089
090        // Protect the forwarder from being changed while used in #log
091        synchronized (this) {
092            this.forwarder = forwarder;
093            if (forwarder == null) {
094                return;
095            }
096            List<LogInfo> tbf;
097            synchronized (buffered) {
098                tbf = new ArrayList<>(buffered);
099                buffered.clear();
100            }
101            forwarder.processBuffered(tbf.toArray(new LogInfo[0]));
102        }
103    }
104
105    /**
106     * Store or forward the logged information.
107     *
108     * @param logInfo the information
109     */
110    public void log(LogInfo logInfo) {
111        // Lock the forwarder. May not change while being used.
112        synchronized (this) {
113            if (forwarder != null && forwarder.process(logInfo)) {
114                return;
115            }
116        }
117        logInfo.setThreadName(Thread.currentThread().getName());
118        // We need to infer this information now, won't be possible later.
119        logInfo.getLogRecord().getSourceClassName();
120        synchronized (buffered) {
121            if (buffered.size() == bufferSize) {
122                buffered.removeFirst();
123            }
124            buffered.add(logInfo);
125        }
126    }
127
128    /**
129     * Holds the information from a logger invocation.
130     */
131    public static class LogInfo {
132        private Class<?> callingClass;
133        private LogRecord logRecord;
134        private String threadName;
135
136        /**
137         * Instantiates a new log info.
138         *
139         * @param definingClass the calling class
140         * @param logRecord the log record
141         */
142        public LogInfo(Class<?> definingClass, LogRecord logRecord) {
143            super();
144            this.callingClass = definingClass;
145            this.logRecord = logRecord;
146        }
147
148        /**
149         * Sets the thread name. Only required if the log info
150         * has to be buffered.
151         *
152         * @param threadName the new thread name
153         */
154        public void setThreadName(String threadName) {
155            this.threadName = threadName;
156        }
157
158        /**
159         * Gets the thread name.
160         *
161         * @return the threadName
162         */
163        public final String getThreadName() {
164            return threadName;
165        }
166
167        /**
168         * Gets the calling class.
169         *
170         * @return the callingClass
171         */
172        public Class<?> getCallingClass() {
173            return callingClass;
174        }
175
176        /**
177         * Gets the log record.
178         *
179         * @return the logRecord
180         */
181        public LogRecord getLogRecord() {
182            return logRecord;
183        }
184
185    }
186}
